text.div:
AllergyIntoleranceType

Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk

This value set has an inline code system http://hl7.org/fhir/allergy-intolerance-type, which defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
allergy AllergyImmune-mediated hypersensitivity reaction.
intolerance IntoleranceAdverse reaction to a substance, not judged to be immune-mediated (non-allergic). This can include (but is not limited to) pseudoallergic reactions, side effects, drug toxicities (e.g. to Gentamicin), drug-drug interactions, food-drug interactions, and drug-disease interactions.

name: AllergyIntoleranceType
description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk

concept.definition: Adverse reaction to a substance, not judged to be immune-mediated (non-allergic).  This can include (but is not limited to) pseudoallergic reactions, side effects, drug toxicities (e.g. to Gentamicin), drug-drug interactions, food-drug interactions, and drug-disease interactions.
